meaningMnemonic: The water from a <radical>tsunami</radical> can create a lot of <radical>energy</radical> when made into <kanji>steam</kanji>. Steam power used to be all the rage back in the day. Steam comes from water, water comes from tsunamis, so logically, tsunamis are a great source of energy.
readingMnemonic: In order to contain this <kanji>steam</kanji> energy and store it for later, you lock it up in a box with a <reading>key</reading> (き). That way the energy can be used at a later time. Provided you don’t lose the key, that is.
